page.title: 02COMMUNICATIONS.
page.content: {POST AND TELEPHONE IN OWSTON {____________________________ The telephone is essential for this isolated community and every family has its own which is operated from an exchange at Somerby but is linked to the national network.It is used for business,emergency and maintaining family links.In addition there is a public telephone box centrally situated. There is no village post office but a post box in the centre of the village is emptied twice daily by a post van from Oakham which makes one delivery of mail in the morning.Mail is sorted in Leicester and ,in the event of express letters,a special delivery is made.A notice board outside the village hall is used to keep people living in the village informed about local events.
